required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: An objective of JIPS Registry is to examine disease behavior of idiopathic interstitial pneumonias (IIPs), considering classification, background, and diagnostic methods based on American Thoracic Society (ATS)/ European Respiratory Society(ERS) /Japanese Respiratory Society (JRS)/ Latin American Thoracic Association (ALAT) guidelines for diagnosis and the ATS/ERS classification of 2002 and 2013.

detailed_description.textblock:
JIPS Registry is a multi-site, non-interventional, prospective observation study of patients with newly diagnosed IIPs in Japan. At least 600 patients will be registered for 16 months at approximately 80 sites in Japan.
Primary research question is to determine the natural history of each category of IIPs at registration, patient background and diagnosis methods will be considered. Furthermore, the present treatment patterns and disease behavior (CT and forced vital capacity (FVC) changes, as well as changes in interstitial pneumonia markers, etc.) will also be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: Data on current practice patterns for diagnosis of IIPs
primary_outcome.description: Describe the frequency of surgical lung biopsy, bronchoalveolar lavage.
Investigate the prevalence of each categorized IIPs by using a recent guideline

primary_outcome.measure: Natural history of each categorized IIPs
primary_outcome.description: Describe the natural history of each categorized IIPs, focusing on CT findings, FVC changes, medications, and causes of death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival by category of IIPs
Hospital admission for acute exacerbations of IIPs
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate incidences, therapy and prognosis of acute respiratory deterioration in patients with IIPs

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change of patient-reported outcome (Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire, COPD assessment test, and Dyspnoea-12) every12 months from baseline

secondary_outcome.description: Multidisciplinary discussion (MDD) held by independent central reviewers will be conducted twice at the time of registration and final observation using questionnaire. Concordance rate for diagnosis and disease behavior in each case between the time of registration and final observation will be evaluated.

study_pop.textblock: Newly diagnosed IIPs within 6 months before registration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients aged between 20 and 84 years
2. Patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) and other IIPs diagnosis within 6 months before registration at each facility
3. Patients from whom written informed consent has been obtained regarding participation in this study and follow-up observation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients for whom the tests (such as the lung function test) conducted in this study could not be performed
2. Patients who underwent pulmonary resection
3. Patients undergoing dialysis
4. Patients with cancer treated at the time of registration or those planning to receive treatment in the future
